response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("age", "medium", "Young adults, particularly males, are statistically at a higher risk for recidivism."),
    ("gender", "high", "Males generally have higher recidivism rates compared to females."),
    ("race", "medium", "Certain racial demographics may experience systemic issues that contribute to higher recidivism."),
    ("prior_arrest", "medium", "Having a prior arrest, even without a conviction, can indicate a higher risk of future offenses."),
    ("marital_status", "low", "Being unmarried may correlate with higher risk, but it is not a strong predictor on its own."),
    ("living_situation", "medium", "Living alone can lead to isolation, which may increase the risk of reoffending."),
    ("education", "low", "Having a high school diploma is a positive factor, but not being enrolled in further education may limit opportunities."),
    ("employment", "medium", "Holding a job is positive, but only having one job in the past year may indicate instability."),
    ("substance_use", "low", "Not using drugs in the past four years is a strong protective factor."),
    ("mental_health", "high", "Feeling persistently down can indicate underlying mental health issues, which are linked to higher recidivism."),
    ("family_background", "medium", "Growing up in a household with multiple members can have mixed effects, but urban environments may present additional challenges."),
    ("spiritual_beliefs", "low", "Belief in a higher power may provide some psychological support, but its impact on recidivism is unclear.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

risk_factors: Young adults, particularly males, are statistically at a higher risk for recidivism.
Males generally have higher recidivism rates compared to females.
Certain racial demographics may experience systemic issues that contribute to higher recidivism.
Having a prior arrest, even without a conviction, can indicate a higher risk of future offenses.
Being unmarried may correlate with higher risk, but it is not a strong predictor on its own.
Living alone can lead to isolation, which may increase the risk of reoffending.
Having a high school diploma is a positive factor, but not being enrolled in further education may limit opportunities.
Holding a job is positive, but only having one job in the past year may indicate instability.
Not using drugs in the past four years is a strong protective factor.
Feeling persistently down can indicate underlying mental health issues, which are linked to higher recidivism.
Growing up in a household with multiple members can have mixed effects, but urban environments may present additional challenges.
Belief in a higher power may provide some psychological support, but its impact on recidivism is unclear.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 8 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and most of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
